intro: Orthosiphon pretoriae, commonly known as the Pretoria siphon, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant features square stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, tubular, and typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates.
